name: Map of Roshar
title: {page} | The Stormlight Archive

ui.welcome: Welcome to the unofficial interactive map and timeline of Brandon Sanderson's *The Stormlight Archive* series of books!
ui.aboutText:
Welcome to our Interactive Map and Timeline of Roshar!

This website allows you to explore the map of Roshar and the timeline of Brandon Sanderson's *Stormlight Archive* series. Clicking locations on the map will reveal details about it as well as related events and characters. Browsing the timeline at the bottom of the page allows you to jump between different events on the map and open up more information about those events. If you want to know even more, links to the Coppermind wiki are provided.

This is a fan-made project that is not affiliated with Dragonsteel Entertainment. All dates and locations are based on a combination of in-world references and our own estimates and assumptions. If you would like to dig further into the timeline of the series, or if you are curious about the references and assumptions used, please visit [Jofwu's Stormlight Archive Timeline project](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1zq5bJoKE83ggDCjH43i1hZi0CIpB2iAx7v37zQPVFK0).

Make sure you check out the tutorial if you haven't done so! We hope that you find this to be a fun, insightful, and helpful tool as you read *The Stormlight Archive*!

first-visit.heading: Welcome
first-visit.intro:
**Spoilers up to the end of *Dawnshard* and *Rhythm of War* ahead!** Continue at your own risk.

It looks like this is your first use of this app. Would you like some help?

You can always find help later on from the menu to the top right.

tutorial.title: Tutorial
tutorial.explanation: Click on any of the red dots to find out what you can do with the app.

settings-button.title: Settings Menu
settings-button.text: Adjust display & filter settings for the map and timeline

menu-button.title: Menu
menu-button.text: Find helpful links and language settings

search.title: Search
search.text: Search for events, characters, locations, and more

timeline.title: Timeline
timeline.text: Navigate this timeline by scrubbing or scrolling and click on any of the diamonds to view the associated event

event.title: Event Details
event.text: Click the "More" link to get a detailed summary, related information and where to find the event in the book, if applicable

location.title: Location Details
location.text: Click on any named location to view a detailed description and associated information

settings-layers.title: Layers
settings-layers.text: Layers can provide additional useful information on top of the map view. They can be toggled at any time

settings-filters.title: Filters
settings-filters.text: Filters allow you to decide which events are displayed on the timeline. You may hide them completely or create a separate timeline that focuses on the filtered item

settings-separate-timelines.title: Separate Timelines
settings-separate-timelines.text: Once you've started displaying a filter as separate timeline, you can find it labeled here. Use the drag handle to change the order the timelines are displayed in

measure-button.title: Measurements
measure-button.text: Measure distances on the map and get exact coordinates for locations

go-to-date-button.title: Go to Date
go-to-date-button.text: Jump to an arbitrary date on the timeline

start.name: Start
start.explanation: This is one year in the Rosharan calendar. It corresponds to 1.1 years on Earth.

day.name: Day
day.explanation: Each day is 20 Rosharan hours long.

month.name: Month
month.explanation: Each month spans 50 days, or 10 weeks.

year.name: Year
year.explanation: A year amounts to 10 months, 100 weeks, or 500 days.

date.name: Dates
date.explanation:
Dates are written as the year first, month second, week third, and day last. The numbers are separated by periods.

For example, this date in year 1173 is written: {date}

error-screen.message:
Whoops... Looks like the app cannot be loaded in your browser for some reason.

Please consider visiting using a [modern browser](https://browsehappy.com).
error-screen.report-intro: Think this is an actual error?

errors.year-required: You must fill out the year!
errors.month-required: You must fill out the month!
errors.week-required: You must fill out the week!

measurement.title: Measurement
measurement.explanation:
Click any two points to calculate their positions and the distance between them.

On desktop, **[Ctrl]**-click to add multiple points.

On mobile, **long-press** to add multiple points.

Note that the Rosharan degree (¬∞·¥ø) ranges from 0 to 200.

search.title: Search
search.empty-query: Enter your search terms above for results to appear here
search.no-results: Unfortunately, we couldn't find anything for those search terms

sharing.title: Share
sharing.global-message: Check out the Interactive Map & Timeline of Roshar!

changelog:
Welcome to the updated Map & Timeline of Roshar! We've added all events, locations, and characters from both *Dawnshard* and *Rhythm of War*, so if you have not read those titles yet, be careful! ## What's new? Besides all the current book content, we've been hard at work on new features and general improvements to the map and timeline. Here are the most memorable ones: * üîé **Search:** You can now search events, locations, characters, and more! This feature can be found in the top-right corner next to the settings menu button. * üìê **Measurements:** We consulted the royal cartographer Isasik Shulin and did the math! Accessible from the compass-looking button to the top right of the timeline, you may now measure distances across Roshar and get coordinates for any location on the continent. As a bonus, the graticule we draw on the map should now be more accurate, too!
*Note that measurements are based on our own research and might not be entirely accurate.* * ‚ö†Ô∏è **Spoiler Filters:** The book filters, under settings, have been reworked to act as spoiler filters! You can now disable events for any books you haven't read, preventing them from appearing on the timeline.
*Note that those events will still appear under 'Related Events' on the detailed view of locations or characters, however.* * ü§ù **Sharing:** While we don't exactly have Spanreed technology, there now are easily accessible sharing buttons in the details views of everything you can view on the map and timeline! Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, and Tumblr are supported by default, but on supported devices such phones, you can use any available sharing option. * üìç **Updated Shadesmar Map:** We found a perpendicularity and had the chance to explore Roshar's Cognitive subastral! The map of Shadesmar has been updated with some of the locations we know so far. If you find any issues or errors with any of these changes, feel free to let us know in our [feedback thread](https://www.17thshard.com/forum/topic/92801-interactive-map-and-timeline-of-roshar-feedback/) or with a [GitHub issue](https://github.com/Palanaeum/roshar-map/issues)! Have fun exploring this updated experience!
